p: The antifungal potential of TEO has been demonstrated also on other types of fungi. Thus, the study performed by Tantaoui-Elaraki et al. [ 53] investigated the effect of TEO on Aspergillus parasiticus in vitro conditions and reported that the minimum inhibitory concentration for this type of fungi was 0.1%. Also, it has been proved that TEO has shown a strong antifungal activity on Verticillium dahliae, Fusarium sp., Penicillium sp., and Aspergillius sp. [ 54]. Among Thymus, Rosmarinus, and Eucalyptus, essential oils it has been found that TEO showed the lowest inhibitory concentration against the fungal growth [ 55].
